column4: is there a way to format pendrives in linux..currently its not formatted and i want to format i=to NTFS but it aint showing up in ubuntu
partition it to make a ntfs partition, then use mkfs.ntfs  - or use gparted
check that its seen with 'sudo fdisk -l'  If fdisk dosent even see it. well theres some deeper issues going on
just because gnome dosent automount it - does not mean its not 'seen'
check it via the terminal. Gnomes auto mount stuff can be flakey at times
check that its seen with 'sudo fdisk -l'
fdisk shows disks. reguardless of if they are formated or not
if fdisk is not showing it. then theres some bigger problems. check the output of 'dmesg'  as you insert the device.
it could be dead.. or some other odd issue.
plug it in.. run 'dmesg' wait a few sec.. run 'dmesg' again.. watch what it says.. or use 'tail -f /var/log/messages' to watch for kernel messages as you insert it
this was  wat i got
you should get more messages thjen that.  Eventually it will mention a /dev/sdXX  name for the pendrive
untill you determine that /dev/sd## name - you are not going to be doing much with it
and if 'sudo fdisk -l' is not showing the device at all. Its possible the flash drive is bad/going bad. or you could try a different usb port
Untill you get that.. you are not going to be doing much with it.
some line similer to --> [187643.581913] sd 22:0:0:0: [sdh] 7567360 512-byte logical blocks: (3.87 GB/3.60 GiB) --- SDH is the drive name in this example
its sdb then...
sudo mkfs.ntfs /dev/sdb1         IF YOU ARE SURE thats the proper drive...
if you are guessing wrong.. that will format the disk.
